cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi (225 km) south of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW, forecast to pass near/over Hispaniola Thursday, cross or skirt eastern Cuba and the SE Bahamas Friday, then turn toward the NW Bahamas and southern Florida late Friday into Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida or the NW Bahamas (close coastal encounter rather than a classic Gulf landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas (Cat Island, Exumas, Long Island, Rum Cay, San Salvador)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Entire coasts of the Dominican Republic and Haiti, Turks & Caicos, Southeastern Bahamas (Acklins, Crooked Island, Long Cay, Inaguas, Mayaguana, Ragged Islands), Puerto Rico and adjacent islands, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, northern Leeward Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, Cuba, Bahamas, and much of the Florida Peninsula including both east and west coasts
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (most guidance shows 2–4 inches for west-central FL)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (guidance suggests 1–2 ft possible in Tampa Bay with on-shore flow)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force gusts (40–55 mph) possible Saturday, highest in outer rain bands
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in Tampa Bay if strong easterly flow develops
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could deliver 2–4 in of rain with localized heavier pockets, producing brief flooding in low-lying terminal areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas in approaches; intermittent squalls reducing visibility and hampering cargo handling
